concept.title: Accessing Windows Calculator
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes how to access the Windows Calculator.

conbody.p: There are two (2) ways of accessing the Windows Calculator. Both approaches are described below.

section.title: Accessing Windows Calculator— Method 1
section.p: This section outlines the first method of accessing the Windows Calculator.
section.note: In this context, we are considering Windows 10.

ol.li:
Click on the Start button in the bottom-left corner of your desktop/laptop screen (refer to the figure below). Clicking Windows Start Button
The list of programs currently installed in your machine shows up. Scroll through the list and locate the Calculator program. This is shown in the figure below. Locating Calculator in the List of Programs

Click Calculator ().
The Calculator app opens up, as shown in the figure below. The Windows Calculator App (Standard Mode)

section.p: Now you can use the Calculator app to conduct arithmetic operations.

section.title: Accessing Windows Calculator— Method 2
section.p: This section outlines the second method of accessing the Windows Calculator.

ol.li: Locate the Windows Search box at the bottom of your desktop/laptop screen. This is to the right of the Windows Start button. Refer to the figure below. Windows Search Box

Enter the search string 'Calculator' in the Windows Search box. Once you enter that, Windows automatically finds the Calculator app for you as a Best Match. This is illustrated in the figure below. Finding Calculator App as a Best Match

Click the Calculator app item in the Best Match list. Alternatively, click Open on the right as illustrated in the following figure. Opening the Calculator App
This will open the Calculator app.

section.title: The Two Calculator Modes— Standard and Scientific
section.p: There are two modes of the Windows Calculator app that are commonly used— Standard and Scientific. The Standard mode is suitable for basic arithmetic operations, while the Scientific mode is suitable for advanced mathematical operations like Trigonometric and Logarithmic operations.
The following figure displays both these modes side by side.

fig.title: Windows Calculator Modes— Standard and Scientific

section.note: For the current project, we will be using the Standard mode of the Calculator app.
section.p: If by chance, you land up in the Scientific mode, you can easily switch back to the Standard mode. Locate the Navigation icon, as shown in the following figure. Calculator App— Locating the Navigation Icon

Click the Navigation icon to expand the list of menu items. Next, click the Standard menu item on the expanded list, as shown in the following figure. This will open up the Calculator in Standard mode. Calculator App— Clicking the Standard Navigation Option
